definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.chinese: 聪明绝顶的完美主义者。

sentences.english: We are both incredibly intelligent people.
sentences.chinese: 我们都是聪明绝顶的人物。

sentences.english: He is handsome, charming, highly intelligent, and a master of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他英俊迷人，聪明绝顶，是个伪装高手。

sentences.english: I've seen a lot of very smart people who have lacked these virtues.
sentences.chinese: 我看过很多聪明绝顶的人，但都缺乏这些特质。

sentences.english: This shows he was incredibly intelligent.
sentences.chinese: 那他还真是聪明绝顶啊。

sentences.english: The simple brilliance of the plan filled me with hope.
sentences.chinese: 这个简单而聪明绝顶的计划让我充满了希望。

definition: erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
deceitful in many ways (idiom); wily and mischievous/full of craft and cunning
to prophesy with supernatural accuracy (idiom)/to have an incredible foresight
